description: From Middle English marred, merred (“troubled, distressed, vexed, bewildered”), from Old English *mierred, ġemyrred (“disturbed, troubled”), past participle of Old English mierran, ġemyrran (“to hinder, obstruct, force, trouble, err”), equivalent to mar +‎ -ed.

adjectives.description: marred (comparative more marred, superlative most marred)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Of a person, perplexed or troubled
(Yorkshire) Of a child, spoilt, cosseted, overly indulged
simple past tense and past participle of mar
